intro: Cryptantha calycotricha, commonly known as the California flax or desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and open grasslands. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. The fruit is a slender pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
